message:
"I want the store to have 400,000 apps"
"... but it's not easy to do that, boss"
"I don't care what you do, just do it"
"Yes, boss"
http://www.howtogeek.com/194993/the-windows-store-is-a-cesspool-of-scams-why-doesnt-microsoft-care/
caption: Attachment UnavailableThis attachment may have been removed or the person who shared it may not have permission to share it with you.

data.message:
I've witnessed a similar (but less horrible) mentality in the MSP program here, they were pushing students to submit any kind of apps to the store (even that first one you make just to learn about the platform) and get prizes based on the number of apps the submit.
I'm not claiming that all the students submitted crap (I know many who learned and became excellent WP/Win8 developers!), I'm saying that there were a few times when someone made like 10 apps with static content (just some text and images) and won a Lumia phone or something like that, thankfully these apps were free so it's much better than these scams.
i remember a competition that was made be a Microsoft group here in Egypt that the winner have to make 10 apps in a month to win , and the more apps you make the more you get chance to win

why we always forget that we won't use the computer as users or developers if Microsoft wasn't exist , seriously attacking everything about Microsoft with this extreme way is just a tune of fashion and not the voice of fair, only those who have been there before the windows who really knows what does Microsoft mean

Ahmed Ali If you knew me, you'd know that people call me a Microsoft fanboy, I actually like Windows 8 and I have a WP8 device :D
But what this article is saying is true specially for the Windows 8 Store, the Windows Phone Store doesn't suffer that much from scams and their certification process is more strict.
I'm agreeing with this because I find the Windows 8 Store disappointing compared to the Windows Phone Store, and these MSP-related competitions actually made me less encouraged to make apps and take part because under no condition will I be able to make 10 apps in a month, I just can't make crappy stuff even if I will win a Lumia for it!

am actually working with Microsoft technology more than anything else  , but that does not mean i cant criticize them when they do something wrong  ,and i think judging software by quantity not quality qualifies

and by the way amr have just posted something about android also  , so   nobody hate anything here  ... just Geeks being Geeky  :)

well , you have a good point , you are right , i was a little sharp , sorry man :) , just i meant generally people attack Microsoft for no reasons, but i can't forget the giant step of the computer history it came to me by Microsoft without debating about the original owner
